Land Preparation and Crop Establishment

          Proper preparation of the field prior to planting has to be done to make it favorable for seed germination, crop establishment, and successive management of the crop. Also, this will facilitate proper implementation of field operations, i.e. furrow irrigation.

 

Preparing the Land

Prepare thoroughly the land to render better seed germination and high yield.

1. Plow and harrow the production area twice. 

  2. Set the furrows at 75 cm apart. 

  3. Zero tillage can be done if the area is free from weeds or the population is not high.

  4. Spray a pre-emergence herbicide to manage weed growth.

 

Planting

In planting, the following should be practiced:

1. In a hectare of land, the seeding rate is 10-15 kg/ha. 

  2. Apply basal fertilizer or organic fertilizer

  3. Sow 2-3 seeds per hill with a distance of 50 cm apart at a depth of 2-3 cm for hill method of planting. 

  4. Maintain 2 seedlings per hill. 

  5. For drill method of planting, sow 15-18 seeds per line and sow at a depth of 2-3 cm with 100 cm between rows.

 

Trellising and Vine Training

Install trellis as follows:

1. Provide crops with poles or trellis at 14 days after emergence (DAE).

  2. Use vertical trellis with one-meter distance between rows for single row. Ipil-ipil, bamboo and kakawate poles are installed 3-4 m apart within the rows and are secured on top with GI wire #16.

  3. Tie the top wire to the stakes at the end of the rows to make the poles stable. Plastic straw is used at the bottom portions in every row. 

  4. Tie straw lines vertically from top to bottom in every hill. A-type trellis is used for double row plots at 0.75 m apart. Synthetic straw is also used for the pole sitao to cling on for the trellis.

 

Vine training
Train the crop as the vines develop for them to cling to the trellis and spread evenly until they reach the top.
